title.rendered: The COP 20 in Lima was launched

content.rendered:
On the 1st of December under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, the Climate Change Conference (COP 20) in Lima, Peru was launched.The Conference will be held in Lima until the 12th of December.

COP20 in Lima is of great significance for global nations to negotiate and shape the contribution they will give to vastly reduce their carbon footprint, before reaching a definitive agreement in Paris.

Why attend the Forum?

Take part in order to enhance public-private sector engagement and combat climate change.

A truly global network with the most geographically diverse side event at COP

High-level discussions from world-leading speakers about the most pressing issues on climate change

Uncover global trends and foster innovative opportunities

How to participate in the COP20?

1. The central venue in the General Army Headquarters. It is a space designed for negotiations. Built on 90 thousand square meters, it is an official space and, thus it is closed to the general public.

2. “Voices for Climate” Fair, a space of over 3.600 m2 of interactive exhibition in the Jockey Club, where it will be able open to all and to enter for free to know more about climate change, how it affects us, and what can we do to live in a more sustainable and environmental-friendly way.

Side events Find the list of side events here: https://seors.unfccc.int/seors/reports/events_list.html?session_id=COP20
